stance_1: Eating meat makes me feel run down
stance_2: I try to lower my meat intake
justification: The feeling of being run down after eating meat explicitly supports the motivation to lower meat intake.

stance_1: I get protein from black beans
stance_2: I try to lower my meat intake
justification: Getting protein from black beans supports the effort to lower meat intake by providing an alternative protein source.

stance_1: I get protein from black beans
stance_2: I want meals that do not rely on meat
justification: Choosing black beans as a protein source supports the desire for meals not reliant on meat.

stance_1: I try to lower my meat intake
stance_2: I want meals that do not rely on meat
justification: The desire for meals that do not rely on meat is directly aligned with the effort to lower meat intake.

stance_1: I try to lower my meat intake
stance_2: I want to lower my meat intake for diabetes
justification: Trying to lower meat intake is explicitly motivated by concerns about diabetes.

stance_1: I am cautious of the environment
stance_2: I try to lower my meat intake
justification: Environmental caution is an explicit motivator for lowering meat intake.

stance_1: I feel pressure to fit in by eating meat
stance_2: I try to lower my meat intake
justification: Feeling pressure to fit in by eating meat conflicts with the effort to reduce meat intake.

stance_1: I feel pressure to fit in by eating meat
stance_2: My family and friends eat a lot of meat
justification: The eating habits of family and friends contribute to the feeling of pressure to fit in by eating meat.

stance_1: I feel pressure to fit in by eating meat
stance_2: My family and friends are used to eating meat
justification: The cultural and habitual meat consumption of family and friends is explicitly linked to the pressure felt by the interviewee to fit in.

stance_1: I eat ground chicken and turkey
stance_2: I try to lower my meat intake
justification: Switching to ground chicken and turkey may be part of the strategy to lower meat intake or choose leaner meats, though not explicitly stated.

stance_1: I eat red meat a couple times a week
stance_2: I try to lower my meat intake
justification: Consuming red meat, even if only a couple times a week, is in partial conflict with the goal to lower meat intake.

stance_1: I eat ground chicken and turkey
stance_2: I eat red meat a couple times a week
justification: Eating mostly ground chicken/turkey but still occasionally eating red meat implies a partial conflict in reducing overall meat consumption.

stance_1: I want to lower my meat intake for diabetes
stance_2: I eat red meat a couple times a week
justification: The goal to lower meat intake for diabetes is undermined by continuing to eat red meat a couple times a week.
